to local agents. Batteries, electric CFL bulbs and electronic items containing toxic 
elements need to be disposed carefully by sending them to recyclers or to land-filling. Children should not be allowed to play with batteries or put them in their mouth. In rural areas, if one can’t find waste collectors, one solution is to bury 
hazardous waste away from the village and far from any water source instead of 
throwing them in open areas.
Cleaning the house: It is essential to clean a house daily. The rubbish from the 
house and the kitchen should be collected in a plastic bag and put into a covered 
dustbin. Garbage should not be thrown outside the house, on stairways, in front of the neighbour’s house, verandah or on the road.
